Key Match Events: Iftikhar Ahmed and Shadab Khan rescued Pakistan with the bat with a superb 82-run partnership.
Shadab changed the game in his first over, the leg-spinner having Bavuma caught behind and then bowling Markram through the gate one run later, leaving South Africa 66-4.
Quinton de Kock chipping Shaheen Afridi to Mohammad Haris at midwicket for a duck on the last ball of the first over.
Afridi then removed the dangerous Rilee Rossouw for seven in his second over, caught by Naseem Shah on the third man boundary.
Post-Match Reflections: Their win means Pakistan can still reach the World Cup semi-finals if they win their last match against Bangladesh and other results go their way.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rain-affected, and the target was adjusted from 186 to 142.
The asking rate was too much for South Africa, and they finished on 108-9 at the end of the match.
Others: Pakistan had looked headed for a certain early exit from the tournament as the South African seam attack tore through the top order.
